conclusion: The basketball is dropped from rest at a height H.
It falls under the influence of gravity and air resistance.
The gravitational force acting on the basketball is mg.
The air resistance is given as λmg.

premise: The potential energy at height H is mgH. The work done against air resistance during the fall is λmgH.
conclusion: The kinetic energy just before the collision is 1/2mv^2.
The basketball rebounds to a height h.

premise: The potential energy at height h is mgh. The work done against air resistance during the ascent is λmgh.
conclusion: The kinetic energy just after the collision is 1/2mu^2.

premise: The ratio k of the post-collision velocity u to the pre-collision velocity v is given by: k = u/v = sqrt(2gh(1 + λ))/sqrt(2gH(1 - λ)).

conclusion: The ratio of the post-collision velocity to the pre-collision velocity is k = sqrt(h(1 + λ)/H(1 - λ)).
